page.title: 09NEW HOUSES, HARROW.
page.content: Since the beginning of 1984, new houses have been built in Evelyn Drive which is in{Hatch End.}Each house costs between Â£130,000 and Â£150,000 which is quite expensive. The area is particularly suitable for families because there is a golf course, park and school nearby. There is also a cub scout pack as well as rugby and cricket clubs. These detached houses have 4 bed rooms, 1 bathroom and 2 toilets. The gardens are of an average size. Some of the houses boast 2 garages and fitted kitchens and are like a mini mansion. A{Neighbourhood Watch Scheme,}to help to prevent crime, operates in some areas of Hatch End. If anyone sees something suspicious, they phone a co-ordinator who phones for help. Today, 45 roads are in the scheme.
